intro: Meibomia gardneri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant has fleshy, thick leaves that help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care. Meibomia gardneri thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
